Buttons

Flat Buttons

Raised Buttons

Flat buttons are typically used for less-pronounced actions. In cards, Flat buttonshelp maintain an emphasis on card content. Raised buttons are high-emphasis, distinguished by their use of elevation and fill. They contain actions that are primary to your app. The last example of this demo show how to use buttons: <h3>Flat Buttons</h3> <div class="button-wraper"> <button class="da-button">Default</button> <button class="da-button da-flat-button_colored">Colored</button> <button class="da-button da-flat-button_disabled">Disabled</button> </div> <h3>Raised Buttons</h3> <div class="button-wraper"> <button class="da-button da-raised-button_default">Default</button> <button class="da-button da-raised-button_colored">Colored</button> <button class="da-button da-raised-button_disabled">Disabled</button> </div> FAB Speed Dial
FAB Speed Dial are typically used for less-pronounced actions. They contain actions that are primary to your app.The last example of this demo show how to use buttons: <div class="fab-speed-dial-wraper"> <div class="da-fab-speed-dial"> <button class="da-fab-speed-dial__clear-icon fab-speed-dial__style"> <div class="material-icons grey">clear</div> </button> <button class="da-fab-speed-dial__favorite-icon fab-speed-dial__style"> <div class="material-icons grey">favorite</div> </button> <button class="da-fab-speed-dial__create-icon fab-speed-dial__style"> <div class="material-icons grey">create</div> </button> <button class="da-fab-speed-dial__menu-icon fab-speed-dial__style"> <div class="material-icons white">menu</div> </button> </div> </div> Floating Action Button
Regular
Mini
A floating action button (FAB) performs the primary, or most common, action on a screen. It appears in front of all screen content, typically as a circular shape with an icon in its center. FABs come in three types: regular, mini. Only use a FAB if it is the most suitable way to present a screenâ€™s primary action. The last example of this demo show how to use buttons: <div class="floating-button-wraper"> <div class="da-floating-button"> <div class="da-floating-button__discription da-floating-button__style">Regular</div> <button class="da-floating-button__arrow-icon da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons white">arrow_forward</div> </button> <button class="da-floating-button__create-icon da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons white">create</div> </button> <button class="da-floating-button__add-icon da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons grey">add</div> </button> </div> <div class="da-floating-button-m"> <div class="da-floating-button-m__discription da-floating-button-m__style">Mini</div> <button class="da-floating-button-m__done da-icon-button-m__style"> <div class="material-icons white">done</div> </button> <button class="da-floating-button-m__reply da-icon-button-m__style"> <div class="material-icons white">reply</div> </button> <button class="da-floating-button-m__clear da-icon-button-m__style"> <div class="material-icons grey">clear</div> </button> </div> </div> Icon Buttons
icon buttons
styled
segmented
Icon buttons are typically used for different actions. Sometimes you might want to have icons for certain button to enhance the UX of the application as we recognize logos more easily than plain text. For example, if you have a delete button or create you can label it with a dustbin icon. The last example of this demo show how to use buttons: <div class="icon-button-wraper"> <div class="da-icon-button"> <div class="da-icon-button__discription da-icon-button__style">icon buttons</div> <button class="da-icon-button__el da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons">menu </div> </button> <button class="da-icon-button__el da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons">arrow_back</div> </button> <button class="da-icon-button__el da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons">arrow_forward</div> </button> <button class="da-icon-button__el da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons">done</div> </button> <button class="da-icon-button__el da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons">close</div> </button> <button class="da-icon-button__el da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons">fullscreen</div> </button> <button class="da-icon-button__el da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons">fullscreen_exit</div> </button> <button class="da-icon-button__el da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons">more_vert</div> </button> <button class="da-icon-button__el da-icon-button__style"> <div class="material-icons">refresh</div> </button> </div> <div class="da-styled"> <div class="da-styled__discription da-styled__style">styled</div> <button class="da-styled__el da-styled__style"> <div class="material-icons">favorite </div> </button> <button class="da-styled__el da-styled__style"> <div class="material-icons red">favorite </div> </button> <button class="da-styled__el da-styled__style"> <div class="material-icons grey">favorite </div> </button> </div> <div class="da-segmented"> <div class="da-segmented__discription da-segmented__style">segmented</div> <button class="da-segmented__el da-segmented__style"> <div class="material-icons grey">directions_walk</div> </button> <button class="da-segmented__el da-segmented__style"> <div class="material-icons grey">directions_bike</div> </button> <button class="da-segmented__el da-segmented__style"> <div class="material-icons grey">directions_bus</div> </button> <button class="da-segmented__el da-segmented__style"> <div class="material-icons grey">time_to_leave</div> </button> </div> </div> Inputs
The input tag specifies an input field where the user can enter data. input elements are used within a form element to declare input controls that allow users to input data. An input field can vary in many ways, depending on the type attribute. <div class="inputs-wraper"> <input class="da-inputs-1 da-inputs_style" placeholder="Input name" type="text" required> <input class="da-inputs-2 da-inputs_style" placeholder="Active text input" type="text" required> <div class="da-inputs-3"> <input class="da-inputs-3_in da-inputs_style" placeholder="Invalid text input" type="text" required> <label class="da-inputs-3_lab" for="name">This input requires a value!</label> </div> <input class="da-inputs-4 da-inputs_style" placeholder="I'm disabled" type="text" required> <div class="da-inputs-5"> <label class="da-inputs-5_lab" for="name">Floating label</label> <input class="da-inputs-5_in da-inputs_style" type="text" required> </div> <div class="da-inputs-6"> <label class="da-inputs-6_lab" for="name">Text area</label> <textarea class="da-inputs-6_in da-inputs_style" placeholder="Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, doming noster at quo, nostrud lucilius rationibus ea duo. Vim no mucius dolores. No bonorum voluptatum vis, has iudicabit consectetuer ne. Nullam sensibus vim id, et quo graeci perpetua." type="text" required></textarea> </div> </div> Menus & Menu Items

Forums
A menu displays a list of choices on a temporary surface. They appear when users interact with a button and actions.For example, if you have a delete button or create you can label it with a dustbin icon. The last example of this demo show how to use buttons: <div class="da-menu-items"> <div class="da-menu-items-el"> <button class="da-menu-items-el__but da-menu-items__style"> <div class="material-icons darkgrey">query_builder </div> </button> <div class="da-menu-items-el__discription da-menu-items__style">Recent Articles</div> </div> <div class="da-menu-items-el"> <button class="da-menu-items-el__but da-menu-items__style"> <div class="material-icons darkgrey">assignment_returned</div> </button> <div class="da-menu-items-el__discription da-menu-items__style">Archive</div> </div> <div class="da-menu-items-el"> <button class="da-menu-items-el__but da-menu-items__style"> <div class="material-icons darkgrey">done</div> </button> <div class="material-icons lgrey">error</div> </button> </div> </div> Menu Dropdown
Recent Articles
Archive
Completed
A dropdown menu is a compact way of displaying multiple choices. It appears upon interaction with an element (such as an icon or button) or when users perform a specific action. The last example of this demo show how to use buttons: <div class="da-dropdown"> <div class="da-dropdown__el"> <button class="da-dropdown__el_but da-dropdown__style"> <div class="material-icons dgrey">query_builder </div> </button> <div class="da-dropdown__el_discription da-dropdown__style">Recent Articles</div> </div> <div class="da-dropdown__el"> <button class="da-dropdown__el_but da-dropdown__style"> <div class="material-icons dgrey">assignment_returned</div> </button> <div class="da-dropdown__el_discription da-dropdown__style">Archive</div> </div> <div class="da-dropdown__el"> <button class="da-dropdown__el_but da-dropdown__style"> <div class="material-icons dgrey">done</div> </button> <div class="da-dropdown__el_discription da-dropdown__style">Completed</div> </div> </div> Shadow
You can use this style element simply by adding a class to the appropriate block,for example: <div class="shadow-wraper"> <div class="da-shadow-1 da-shadow_style"></div> <div class="da-shadow-2 da-shadow_style"></div> <div class="da-shadow-3 da-shadow_style"></div> <div class="da-shadow-4 da-shadow_style"></div> <div class="da-shadow-5 da-shadow_style"></div> </div> Tooltips
